outlook_24_72h.base_case: The conflict trajectory points to continued high-intensity hostilities over the next 24-72 hours. With Khamenei's reported death and senior military leadership eliminated, Iran faces a command vacuum but IRGC has vowed severe retaliation. Iran has demonstrated capacity to launch coordinated multi-wave attacks across 14+ US bases and Gulf cities. US and Israel maintain offensive posture with no ceasefire announced. The IRGC's announcement of 'more severe retaliatory measures' suggests Iran will escalate rather than de-escalate. Regional allies (Saudi Arabia, UAE, Jordan) are now directly in the firing line. Expect continued missile/drone exchanges, possible new US naval targeting, and expanded humanitarian casualties.

outlook_24_72h.de_escalation_pathways: De-escalation pathways are extremely limited at present. The death of Khamenei removes a key figure for potential negotiations and creates a leadership vacuum that may delay any diplomatic engagement. Oman's mediation efforts represent the most viable channel but have not produced results. Iraq's call for ceasefire has gone unheeded. For de-escalation to occur, either Iran must decide the cost of continued retaliation outweighs benefits, or the US must choose to accept a ceasefire despite its military advantage — neither appears likely in the near term. The UN Secretary-General's expression of regret over diplomatic failure underscores the collapsed diplomatic channel.
